task.title: Editing or deleting an Android Virtual Device (AVD)

context.p: To delete an existing AVD, ensure that it is not running (select it in the Device Management view and click Stop if necessary), then right-click it in the Device Management view and select Delete.

step.cmd: Click the Device Management tab, if necessary, to bring forward the Device Management view.
Right-click the AVD and select Properties.
step.stepresult: The Android Virtual Device properties dialog appears.

step.cmd: To alter the timeout, click Android Virtual Device in the left part of the dialog, and then change the timeout value in the field on the right.
step.info: Note that you cannot change the name, target, skin, or path for an existing AVD.

step.cmd: Click Startup Options on the left side of the dialog.

Alter the AVD's startup options using the User Interface, Disk Images, Network, System, and Others tabs. Note that only the more commonly-used AVD options are presented on these tabs; if you need to specify additional options, enter them into the field on the Others tab, command-line style.

info.p: For a description of each of the startup options displayed on the various tabs, see . For all of the possible command-line arguments, see http://d.android.com/guide/developing/tools/emulator.html#startup-options.

Except on Mac OS X, to work with the emulator in a separate window simply close the Android Emulator view and click No when you are asked if running emulator instances should be stopped. Opening the Android Emulator view while the emulator is running externally causes the emulator to be shown in the view. On Mac OS X, things work somewhat differently: see for instructions.

taskbody.result: Your changes are saved and the dialog is closed.
